title.narrative: DRRR / EMERGENCY RESPONSE

description.narrative: Psychosocial Support in Schools (COVID), which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development (Covid), Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Skills Development, Supply And Logistics, Supply And Logistics (Covid), Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, school aged girls and boy, especially the most marginalized, successfully complete pre-primary and primary education.

sector.narrative: CO/RO Supply - technical assistance and collaboration in supply chain, procurement of goods and services, and logistics
Education and training in water supply and sanitation
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Integrating ECD in emergency preparedness and response
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education
Water supply - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Psychosocial Support in Schools (COVID)

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to respond to the impact of the 7.5 Richter scale earthquake in 2018 and ensured the education and protection of 22,052 children (Girls: 9,375) and their teachers in Hela and Southern Highland provinces, bringing the total number of children supported by UNICEF to 30,726 children (Girls: 13,226) to access quality education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020
